Class AmazonWebServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • AmazonWebServer

  • public class AmazonWebServer
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Elliot Lohr This class provides a blueprint for a AmazonWebServer node which reads in orders from a file and sends them to the shipping centers depending on which city the order is going to

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  AmazonWebServer.WorkerThread
      Thread created that holds information about AWStasks and pulls information from queue and assigns it to the correct ShippingCenter

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean finishedParsing
      Atomic boolean tracks whether the filereader is done parsing
      private java.util.logging.Logger log
      Thread safe output to console
      private java.util.concurrent.ArrayBlockingQueue<AwsTask> queue
      queue used as a buffer between nodes
      private ShippingCenter[] shippingCenters
      an array of ShippingCenters that the webserver can send orders to
      private java.lang.Thread thread
      thread that runs until it finds a shippingCenter that will accept the order

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AmazonWebServer(java.lang.String fileName, ShippingCenter[] shippingCenters)
      Constructor for an AmazonWebServer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void waitUntilDone()
      Method to join the AmazonWebServer threads with the main thread, waits for the nodes to join threads
